body:
Ok, looking into this more closely: you can swap input and output for `leaky_relu` and `rrelu`.
The derivative is a constant that depends on the sign of the input, which is equal to the sign of the output.

For `hardtanh`: the derivative is 0 for `x<-1` and `x>1` and 1 otherwise. Input and output are the same in the `-1 <= x <= 1` interval, so we're good. For `x<-1` and `x>1` the output is `y = -1` and `y = 1`, respectively, for which (I looked in THNN) _updateGradInput returns 0. So they're effectively the same.
